author: xrchz
content: is there interest in adding postStates to the ethereum tests that don't have them?  if so who would it be good to talk to about that?

author: xrchz
content: i noticed this kind of issue didn't get any traction <https://github.com/ethereum/tests/issues/1405> so not sure how active the repo is lol

author: spencer_tb
content:
we are maintaining EEST predominantly now for tests: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests

we do plan to fully port over all of the tests from `ethereum/tests` to `ethereum/execution-spec-tests`, and assuming the latter all tests will have a postState

author: spencer_tb
content: <@393119312350543872> should be able to help with this one

author: spencer_tb

author: dimitry8570
content:
at the moment we recommend to use both execution spec releases and ethereum/tests  
as described in release message 

```
rom now on there would be no new test vectors in this repository and existing ones will slowly be converted into https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests. NOTE: Pyspecs doesn't cover all the vectors from this repo, but has many new vectors that are not covered in ethereum/tests
Eventually there will be only ethereum/legacytests repo with all .json tests from Frontier to Cancun.
And ethereum/execution-spec-tests will handle all the official ethereum testing vectors for all the froks.
```
